name: Palak Paneer
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
2. Once the cumin seeds crackle, add the chopped onion and sauté till it turns golden brown.
3. Add grated ginger and chopped green chillies. Sauté for a minute.
4. Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until it turns mushy.
5. Add turmeric, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well and sauté for a minute.
6. Add the chopped spinach and mix well.
 7. Cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat or until the spinach is cooked and wilted.
8. Add salt to taste.
 9. Add cubed paneer and mix gently.
10. Cook for another 2-3 minutes on low heat.
11. Palak paneer is ready to serve! Enjoy with rice or naan.

name: Spicy Chicken Curry
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
2. Add the chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, chicken broth, curry powder, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the coconut milk and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Serve hot with rice or naan bread. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.

name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 500g chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander leaves, for garnish
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken pieces and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside.
2. In the same skillet, add butter and onion. Cook until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. Add ginger and garlic paste, cook for 1 minute.
4. Add pureed tomatoes, tomato paste, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and red chili powder. Mix well and cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add cooked chicken pieces and mix well. Add heavy cream and salt to taste. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
6. Garnish with chopped fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Chana Masala
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves for garnish
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they splutter, add onions, ginger, garlic, and green chili. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent.
2. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are mushy.
3. Add all the dry spices and cook for a minute.
4. Add the cooked chickpeas and mix well. Add salt and water as needed.
5. Cook for 10-15 minutes or until the curry has thickened.
6. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Samosas
cookingMethod:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, ajwain seeds, and ghee. Mix well and add water gradually to make a stiff dough.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown.
3. Add green peas and sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Add mashed potatoes, red chilli powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin circle and cut it into two halves.
6. Take one half and make a cone shape. Fill the cone with the potato mixture. Seal the edges properly.
7. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Deep fry the samosas until golden brown. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

name: Baingan Bharta
ingredients: 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves, for garnish
cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Pierce eggplant with a fork and place on a baking sheet. Roast in preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
3. Let the eggplant cool, then peel off the skin and mash the flesh.
4. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.
5. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
6. Add chopped green chillies, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
7. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until the mixture turns mushy.
8. Add the mashed eggplant and mix well. Cook for a few minutes.
9. Add salt to taste. Cook for 2-3 more minutes.
10. Baingan bharta is ready to serve. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve with rice or naan.

name: Aloo Gobi
ingredients: 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves, for garnish
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.
2. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chillies. Mix well and cook for a minute.
4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until the mixture turns mushy.
5. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
6. Add diced potatoes and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
7. Add cauliflower florets and mix well. Cook for 10-12 minutes or until the vegetables are cooked through.
8. Add salt to taste. Mix well and cook for 2-3 more minutes.
9. Aloo gobi is ready to serve. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve with rice or naan.

name: Rajma Masala
ingredients: 1 cup kidney beans, soaked overnight and boiled
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
2. Once the cumin seeds crackle, add chopped onions, ginger, garlic and green chilli. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
3. Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until it turns mushy.
4. Add coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and dried fenugreek leaves. Mix well and sauté for a minute.
5. Add the boiled kidney beans and mix well. 
6. Add water as needed and let it simmer for 10-12 minutes on medium heat.
7. Add salt to taste and mix well.
8. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Tandoori Chicken
ingredients: Lemon wedges and onion rings, for garnish
cookingMethod:
1. In a large bowl, mix together yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, lemon juice, vegetable oil, red chilli powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt.
2. Add chicken to the bowl and coat well with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. Preheat the oven to 450°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top.
4. Arrange the marinated chicken on the wire rack and bake for 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.
5. Serve hot with lemon wedges and onion rings for garnish.

name: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: 1 cup chopped mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, cauliflower, capsicum)
cookingMethod:
1. Heat butter in a pan and add cumin seeds.
2. Once the cumin seeds crackle, add chopped onions and sauté till it turns golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chillies. Sauté for a minute.
4. Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until it turns mushy.
5. Add turmeric, coriander powder, red chilli powder, and garam masala. Mix well and sauté for a minute.
6. Add mixed vegetables and mashed potatoes. Mix well.
7. Add salt to taste and cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat or until the vegetables are cooked.
8. Mash the vegetables with a potato masher or a spoon.
9. Add some water if the mixture is too dry. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
10. Toast the pav buns with some butter on a griddle.
11. Serve the bhaji with the toasted pav buns.
12. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and lemon wedges.

name: Chole Bhature
cookingMethod:
1. Drain the soaked chickpeas and pressure cook them with salt and enough water for about 15 minutes, or until they are tender.
2. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
3. Once the cumin seeds crackle, add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chillies. Sauté for a minute.
5. Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until it turns mushy.
6. Add coriander powder, cumin powder, red chilli powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and amchur powder. Mix well and sauté for a minute.
7. Add cooked chickpeas along with the water. Mix well and bring it to a boil.
8. Lower the heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the gravy thickens and the chickpeas are well-coated with the spices. Add more water if required.
9. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
10. Serve hot with Bhature.

name: Malai Kofta
cookingMethod:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine grated paneer, mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, corn flour, cumin seeds, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder and salt. Mix well.
2. Make small balls from the mixture and flatten them slightly to make koftas.
3. Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the koftas until golden brown. Keep aside.
4. In the same pan, add some more oil and heat it.
5. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
6. Add cream, milk and salt. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
7. Add the fried koftas to the gravy and let it simmer for 2-3 minutes.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Pani Puri
cookingMethod:
1. Mix the chickpeas, mashed potatoes, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, chopped coriander leaves, cumin powder, chaat masala, red chilli powder, amchur powder, and black salt in a bowl.
2. Gently crush the puris on the top and make a small hole in each of them.
3. Fill the puris with the prepared mixture.
4. Add a small amount of tamarind chutney and mint-coriander chutney in each puri.
5. Dip the filled puris in the water and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Biryani
cookingMethod:
1. Rinse and soak the rice for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a large pot and sauté the sliced onions until golden brown.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
4. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
6. Add red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
7. Add yogurt and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
8. Add the soaked rice and mix gently.
9. Add enough water to cover the rice by about 1 inch. Bring to a boil.
10. Reduce heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed.
11. Chicken biryani is ready to serve!

name: Prawn Masala
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions until golden brown.
2. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the cleaned prawns and mix gently.
6. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the prawns are cooked through.
7. Add garam masala and mix well.
8. Prawn masala is ready to serve! Enjoy with rice or naan.

name: Vegetable Korma
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, potatoes, peas, etc.)
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion until golden brown.
2. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the mixed vegetables and stir to combine.
6. Cover and cook on medium-low heat for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
7. Add coconut milk and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
8. Vegetable korma is ready to serve! Enjoy with rice or naan.

name: Mutton Rogan Josh
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pressure cooker and sauté the chopped onions until golden brown.
2. Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the mutton pieces and stir to combine.
6. Add yogurt and mix well.
7. Add enough water to cover the mutton by about 1 inch. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the mutton is tender.
8. Mutton rogan josh is ready to serve! Enjoy with rice or naan.

name: Masala Dosa
cookingMethod:
1. Soak urad dal and fenugreek seeds in water for 4-5 hours.
2. In a separate bowl, soak parboiled rice and flattened rice in water for 4-5 hours.
3. Drain the water from both the bowls and grind them separately to form a smooth batter. Mix the two batters together and add water as needed to form a smooth and runny batter. Add salt to taste.
4. Allow the batter to ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight.
5. To make the filling, heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. When they begin to crackle, add cumin seeds and asafoetida. Add chopped onions and green chilies and sauté until onions turn translucent.
6. Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add salt to taste. Set aside.
7. To make the dosa, heat a griddle or a non-stick pan. Once hot, pour a ladleful of batter on the center of the griddle and spread it evenly in a circular motion to form a thin crepe. Drizzle oil on the edges and cook for 1-2 minutes until the dosa turns golden brown in color.
8. Place a spoonful of the potato filling in the center of the dosa and fold the dosa over the filling.
9. Masala dosa is ready to serve! Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve with coconut chutney and sambar.
